1.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a year (as a revolution of time)
ten; by abbreviated form ten strings, and so a decachord
the new moon; by implication, a month
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
properly, to tread or frequent; usually to follow (for pursuit or search); by implication, to seek or ask; specifically to worship
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

2.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
near, with or among; often in general, to

3.brief: a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.
old
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
to say (used with great latitude)
near, with or among; often in general, to
properly, like this, i.e. by implication, (of manner) thus (or so); also (of place) here (or hither); or (of time) now
to say (used with great latitude)
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
{YHWH}
properly, to tread or frequent; usually to follow (for pursuit or search); by implication, to seek or ask; specifically to worship
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
I
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
properly, to tread or frequent; usually to follow (for pursuit or search); by implication, to seek or ask; specifically to worship
an oracle
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
{YHWH}

4.brief: to judge, i.e. pronounce sentence (for or against); by implication, to vindicate or punish; by extenssion, to govern; passively, to litigate (literally or figuratively)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
to judge, i.e. pronounce sentence (for or against); by implication, to vindicate or punish; by extenssion, to govern; passively, to litigate (literally or figuratively)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
properly, something disgusting (morally), i.e. (as noun) an abhorrence; especially idolatry or (concretely) an idol
father, in a literal and immediate, or figurative and remote application

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)

to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
